isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - VIBRATION DAMPER, CRANKSHAFT, MAIN BEARINGS, FLYWHEEL AND CRANKCASE - COMPONENT CHANGES - LUBE OIL FLOW

svcproc.title: LUBE OIL FLOW
svcproc.para: Effective with S/N 525618 the lube oil passage from the main oil gallery to the rocker arm shaft has been changed.

Lube oil to the rocker arm shaft was previously routed through vertical and horizontal drilled passage holes in the crankcase, then around the rear cylinder head bolt to the rocker arm shaft. The vertical oil passage from the rear camshaft bushing was sealed at the crankcase top deck with a steel ball on early production engines. These engines utilized a horizontal drilling in the crankcase to conduct oil from the vertical passage to the rear cylinder head bolt and onto the rocker arm shaft.

caution.para: USE ONLY A CYLINDER HEAD GASKET WITH THE REAR OIL SLOT ON ENGINES WITH S/N AFTER 525617 OR WITH A SERVICE CRANKCASE THAT DOES NOT HAVE THE REAR HEX-SOCKET PLUG.

note.para: The slotted gasket has been updated to eliminate three holes "A" at the front left corner of the gasket. Refer to Figure 7.7. While the three holes are no longer utilized, the surrounding "PRINTOSEAL" remains to enhance gasket sealing. This current gasket will work for service on all DT/DTA-466 engines.
